violate.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc
violate.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Thirty-four protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
violate.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to do something that makes someone feel that they have been attacked or have suffered a great loss of respect
violate.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Victims of burglaries often feel personally violated.
The media regularly violates people’s privacy.
violate.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to break open a grave, or force your way into a holy place without showing any respect
violate.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to force a woman to have sex
violate.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to disobey a law or do something that is against an official agreement, rule etc
violate.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The contractors violated the law by laying off workers without notice.
The proposed legislation would violate existing trade agreements.
violate.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to do something that does not respect someone’s rights, such as their right to be private
violate.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: There was concern that the company was violating customers’ privacy.
